Class Statistics

java.lang.Object
  spie.Statistics

public class Statistics
extends Object

The Class Statistics. This class performs a host of statistical analysis.

Author:
Vincent Xue

getAllReads_Per_KTotalPossiblePositions

private static double getAllReads_Per_KTotalPossiblePositions(int absoluteStart,
                                                              int absoluteEnd,
                                                              ArrayList<Read> compatibleShortReads,
                                                              boolean endExon)
Gets the ratio of all reads (junction and body) to the total number of possible start positions for a short read. The total number of positions can be calculated using the equation [L-2(v-1)]+[(r-1)-2(v-1)] (for inner exons) [L-2(v-1)] (for end exons) where L is the length of the exon r is the length of the short read v is the length of the overlap

Parameters:
absoluteStart - the absolute start of the exon
absoluteEnd - the absolute end of the exon
compatibleShortReads - the ArrayList of compatible ShortReads
endExon - the boolean that specifies whether the current exon is an end exon
Returns:
the ratio of all reads : total number of start positions

public static double getAverage_ReadsPerBase_PerExon(int absoluteStart,
                                                     int absoluteEnd,
                                                     ArrayList<Read> compatibleShortReads)
Gets the ratio of the sum of reads per base to the total number of bases.

Parameters:

absoluteEnd - the absolute end of the exon
compatibleShortReads - the ArrayList of compatible ShortReads
Returns:
the sum of reads body per base divided by total number of bases

getShortReadIfCompatible

private static Read getShortReadIfCompatible(net.sf.samtools.SAMRecord samRecord,
                                             ArrayList<Interval> samInterval,
                                             Collection<Exon> exonList)
Gets a new ShortRead if the SAMRecord is compatible 1) First find the exon where the short read begins 2) Catch the case of a single interval --See if the short read is completely within the exon 3) If more than one interval, check each interval with the next ones. Make sure short read interval has 'start of exon' and end of short read has 'end of exon' (except the last) 4) Check that the last interval matches

Parameters:
samRecord - the SAMRecord that you want to find out is compatible or not
samInterval - the ArrayList of Intervals that contain the genomic coordinates for which a short read spans
exonList - the Collection of exons that the SAMRecord might be found in or cross
Returns:
a new ShortRead is returned if it is compatible. If it is not, null is returned.

getIsoformDensityMap

public static HashMap<Integer,Integer> getIsoformDensityMap(int absoluteStart,
                                                            int absoluteEnd,
                                                            MRNA isoform,
                                                            ArrayList<net.sf.samtools.SAMRecord> iSamRecords)
Gets the isoform density map.A density map is a hash map that has all the genomic coordinates as keys and the number of short reads that cross it as values

Parameters:
absoluteStart - the start of the gene
absoluteEnd - the end of the gene
isoform - the isoform for which you want to get a density map of
iSamRecords - the ArrayList of SAMRecords from which a density map will be generated from
Returns:
The HashMap of where the key is the genomic coordinate and the value is the number of short reads that cross it. This hash map is generate only using compatible reads

getDensityMap

public static HashMap<Integer,Integer> getDensityMap(int absoluteStart,
                                                     int absoluteEnd,
                                                     ArrayList<net.sf.samtools.SAMRecord> iSAMRecords)
Gets the density map. A density map is a hash map that has all the specified coordinates as keys and the count of short reads that cross it as values

Parameters:
absoluteStart - the start of the gene
absoluteEnd - the end of the gene
iSAMRecords - the ArrayList of SAMRecords from which a density map will be generated from
Returns:
The HashMap of where the key is the genomic coordinate and the value is the number of short reads that cross it

getConstituitiveBases

public static ArrayList<Integer> getConstituitiveBases(Collection<MRNA> mrnaList)
Returns an ArrayList of genomic coordinates which are constitutive. This method works by plotting all the coordinates for each MRNA. It then iteratively goes through each coordinate and determines if the number of "hits" for the coordinate equal the number of MRNAs in the list

Parameters:
mrnaList - is a Collection of MRNA.
Returns:
An ArrayList of constitutive genomic coordinates are returned.
